intro: Stemonurus secundiflorus var. lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate stemonurus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, white to yellowish flowers. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
